title: Update versioning, dependencies for 5.3.0 release
body:
* Update version to 5.3.0 to match node release
* Update imported version of Grin crates to 5.3.0
* Cargo update run on `Cargo.lock`

title: Prevent wallet attempting to re-pay a cancelled invoice transaction
body: Prevents #706, more correct behavior is to not attempt to re-pay a transaction that's been cancelled. Payee should request a new invoice in this case.

title: [Contracts] Cancel self-spend TX Pt. 2
body: Missing files from #702

title: Fixes to self-spend cancellation
body:
Uncovered via https://github.com/mimblewimble/grin-gui/issues/79, the logic for cancel was failing when attempting
to cancel a legacy self-spend (i.e. when there are two transaction log entries for the same transaction uuid)

* Updates cancel function to not abort when the number of transaction log entries for a uuid != 1
* Call cancel logic for all transaction log entries with given uuid
* Add test case covering cancelling self-spends by transaction uuid

title: Unify owner + foreign API finalize
body:
Finalize methods for owner and foreign API were taking different paths, leading to invoice transactions not being handled correctly when finalize was called via the owner API. 

* Unify logic into single function and simply call the foreign version from the owner API.
* Add test case to cover calling finalize with an invoice transaction from owner API

Fixes #635

title: Compilation fixes for master
body:
* Cargo update to allow compilation on rust 1.76 and later
* update grin core imports to refer to master

title: Add Self-Spend Cancel + Tests
body:
Uncovered via https://github.com/mimblewimble/grin-gui/issues/82, self-spend transactions previously uncancellable due to the `tx_cancel` function not handling the transaction type properly.

* Updates cancel function to handle explicit self-spends
* Ensure cancelled self spend transactions are properly filtered by advanced query filter
* add cancel test for self-spend transactions

title: [Contracts] Slatepack v5 Deserialization fix
body:
Fix to subtle bug preventing slatepacked slates deserializing payments proof properly, thus preventing RSR contracts transactions working within the GUI wallet. Basically, an enum's fields were in the wrong order.

Adds tests in a few places to check for this in future.

title: [Contracts] Add self spend transaction state
body:
* Adds an explicit `SelfSpend` transaction state, at the moment only set during contracts workflow.
* Sets the type on a transaction during contract workflow when the number of participants in the slate is set to 1

Note this would have a lot of extra areas that needs to be addressed were it used in the legacy wallet workflow. This included on the contracts branch only for experimental purposes and reflected only in the gui project for now.

title: Basic mwmixnet send
body:
Modifications (on experimental 'contracts' branch) to blindly send a transaction to an mwmixnet node as an alternative to calling 'post_tx', with no further transaction information to be recorded internally at the moment.

* Integration of onion + comsig lib directly
* A lot of changes to get build working after croaring + upstream changes

Merging for now, will likely need more work but that can be addressed when there is a mixnet running to send to. Stubs are all in place.

title: [Contracts] Added explicit payment proof tests for both RSR and SRS workflows
body:
* Split tests into explicit RSR and SRS workflows with proof generation in all cases
* Add RSR workflow test

title: Contracts - Test fixes + warning cleanups
body:
* Cleanup of warnings throughout
* Modify existing contract tests to take early payment proofs into account - either proofs need to be explicitly turned off in code or you need to supply a receiver address, mix of both sprinkled throughout (need to think about this).
* General cleanup in preparation for some more contracts/payment proof testing, to be integrated into the gui wallet in turn

title: Trigger CI on push and pull request
body: As titled. Forgot about that part.

title: Update versioning to 5.2.0-beta.1 against grin 5.2.0-beta.3
body: as titled

title: Update CI Badge on README.MD
body: As titled. Replace Azure Pipelines by Github Actions Badge.

title: Cargo lock update
body: Update to cargo lock, update required after updating to rust 1.73

title: Replace Azure Pipelines with Github Actions
body:
As titled. This PR replaces Azure Pipelines (AP) with Github Actions (GA).
Pros:
- GA does not require a microsoft account.
- GA is way more simple and robust.
- GA is well integrated with Github.

Cons: ?


As of today it does exactly the same as what we have:
- Tests all linux packages separately.
- Runs `cargo test --release --all` on macOS and Windows.
- Handles release including binaries, changelog and shasum. Example here https://github.com/quentinlesceller/grin-wallet/releases/tag/v5.2.0-test.1
- One caveat is that we can produce a release even if the tests are not passing. But that would be extremely strange to push a tag if our tests are not working.

To test:
- [x] ~~Windows Release (Waiting for #685 to be merged).~~ Tested and working.

If this is merged I intend to switch grin repo to Github Actions as well.

Also binaries arch are renamed to x86_64 instead of amd64 to avoid confusion with arm64.

title: Update sysinfo crate to 0.29.6
body:
Due to changes in rust, compilation was failing on windows and we need to update the sysinfo crate used by tor process handling to the latest. This also comes with API changes, namely that the `Process` struct can't be instantiated directly and needs to be searched in the `System` struct. 

Changes now needs to be sanity tested on all platforms to ensure tor processes still start and terminate as expected.

Also contains updates to remove deprecation warnings from chrono related updates.

title: Fix build error with Rust 1.71.0
body: As titled. Fixes https://github.com/mimblewimble/grin-wallet/issues/683.

title: [WIP] [Contracts] Early payment proofs
body:
Following on from experimental slate V5, changes, this aims to implement an experimental version of [early proofs](https://github.com/tromp/grin-rfcs/blob/early-payment-proofs/text/0000-early-payment-proofs.md) into the `contracts` branch. Note that `legacy' transaction workflows are not affected.

* Add required arguments structures and definitions
* Add initial test for development purposes
* (TBD)

Other notes
* signature for proof type `Invoice` is automatically generated by default. Generating another proof type or omitting proof requires `opting out` at present (subject to discussion)

title: CI update - Ubuntu Image
body: Ubuntu image 18.04 has been deprecated by azure pipelines. This updates the CI build to use latest ubuntu image 22.04.

title: [Contracts] Experimental Slate v5
body:
Slate V5 changes in order to provide experimental support to [Early Payment Proofs](https://github.com/mimblewimble/grin-rfcs/pull/70#pullrequestreview-1352319887) for use with contract transaction workflows. This aims to provide the new slate fields in a V5 Slate as well as provide all needed v4 conversions and tests. 

Specific slate changes are [WIP]:

PaymentInfoV5 Struct
* `saddr`, i.e. `sender_address` in main Slate becomes optional
* `rsig` is renamed to `psig`, corresponding to rename of `receiver_signature` to `promise_signature` in main Slate
* `ts` added (`timestamp` in main slate). Serialized as i64 representing epoch time in seconds
* `memo` added as optional MemoV5 Struct, which contains:
   * `memo_type`: u8
      * 0x00 = payment details directly embedded
      * 0x01 = Blake2b hash of an arbitrary invoice document
   * `memo`: [u8;32] the memo data itself

* [WIP] Outstanding task remains to implement additional tests that convert back and forth between slate versions.

title: Contract text fixes
body: Just a few minor test fixes needed as a result of wallet api tx query changes.

title: Simple contracts restructured v3
body: Merging Phyro's work to date into an new `contracts` branch for further discussion and consideration. Note this is not planned for any release as of yet.

title: Manual update and verification of prettytable-rs update
body:
* Verified issue in #673 on running installation
* Had cursory look at dependency updates involved in bumping the version of prettytable-rs
* Manually implement #668
